document.title: Colorado Academic Standards: Reading, Writing and Communicating

ABC82D3004714F589A6DC0ACA691B2F0.description: With guidance and support from adults, recall information from experience or gather information from provided sources to answer a question.

717E0643869842D8B7509E8DE097420C.description: Gather relevant information and check various information sources for accuracy (for example: In a class discussion focused on butterflies, students ask questions related to a butterfly and the life cycle.).

F5A6518A710E488E9D1C54DC166AD7E9.description: Use a variety of resources to answer questions of interest through guided inquiry (for example: texts read aloud or viewed, direct observation).

5B3CF83A367446A2A372915C682B1896.description: Ask primary questions of clarity, significance, relevance, and accuracy to improve quality of thinking.

8936C4E73BC34EF8916A933EA1B7F94E.description: Ask a specific question and gather relevant information from various sources related to that question that inform clarity of purpose and conclusions about research.

91A3831DFE634A2BB79A97ADD7DF92E3.description: Identify a clear purpose for research or inquiry (for example: If the class is learning about trees, is my need to know more about pets related?).

4CA1AE3FB7784E838CCC340BE0A584C5.description: Participate in shared research and writing projects (for example: explore a number of books by a favorite author and express opinions about them).

7A40083FE1B04C22BFB5ECC7B48575A1.description: Explore the purposes for research and inquiry by accessing resources in collaborative settings.

7C7911D68B454D759CA3A825711C401B.description: Spell simple words phonetically, drawing on knowledge of sound-letter relationships.

CB125BDCABCD42BA8C9E03E272935115.description: Write a letter or letters for most consonant and short-vowel sounds (phonemes).

2F3EF565F56049E4A11E7D271C8CC204.description: Capitalize the first word in a sentence and the pronoun I.

6C3E85702DC545099ADD5E455E9F3C13.description: Demonstrate command of the conventions of Standard English capitalization, punctuation, and spelling when writing.

32CCDEA4FA704896B873B0568776E983.description: Produce and expand complete sentences in shared language activities.

F0BE804DFFA24AE5A61D4E59E47C050E.description: Use the most frequently occurring prepositions (for example: to, from, in, out, on, off, for, of, by, with).

6CB3CDD69AE44E58A3E05A8002C6DA7C.description: Understand and use question words (interrogatives) (for example: who, what, where, when, why, how).

E0C88FAAA5A34EA4B56F4C4A95821AF4.description: Form regular plural nouns orally by adding /s/ or /es/ (for example: dog, dogs; wish, wishes).

874C4DE1276D42E5845CB2C194EA2C9A.description: Use frequently occurring nouns and verbs.

9EBC7AF8E99D48F4AE9F878C834BEB5D.description: Print many upper- and lowercase letters.

D0D7E982EBE749B9967CD52C7CB1AE08.description: Demonstrate command of the conventions of Standard English grammar and usage when writing or speaking.

B55A0F0BC32144B4A2A0069BC6A211B3.description: Use appropriate mechanics and conventions when creating simple texts.

7562806D65CB4ABA8EF4090F28C6ED40.description: With guidance and support from adults, explore a variety of digital tools to produce and publish writing, including in collaboration with peers.

0B523ECE9EAB4F26933A3872CA0D2C19.description: With guidance and support from adults, respond to questions and suggestions from peers and add details to strengthen writing as needed.

9F7155EC0EF845719B2366CE693FB72F.description: Use a combination of drawing, dictating, and writing to narrate a single event or several loosely linked events, tell about the events in the order in which they occurred, and provide a reaction to what happened.

C62E9B74CB864AFA8DD8D8D443EF82BC.description: Write real or imagined narratives using labels, dictation, and drawing.

FC0A34DA894F42F7BA10C1468945FA15.description: With guidance and support from adults, explore a variety of digital tools to produce and publish writing, including in collaboration with peers.

32EDA1266F1F4D17877622C7CCFC3233.description: With guidance and support from adults, respond to questions and suggestions from peers and add details to strengthen writing as needed.

A331FB8B7DFF4C16BDA12C599DA84ABD.description: Use a combination of drawing, dictating, and writing to compose informative/explanatory texts in which they name what they are writing about and supply some information about the topic.

9FA27647183C4F688AA689E687656818.description: Write informative/explanatory texts on a topic using labels, dictation, and drawing.

F86D00FD1CCE425185C8CDC73BD93C43.description: With guidance and support from adults, explore a variety of digital tools to produce and publish writing, including in collaboration with peers.

798386F5C2F94161BAD3C045559D3D42.description: With guidance and support from adults, respond to questions and suggestions from peers and add details to strengthen writing as needed.

180A84124B6647498E93B1200D0208C9.description: Use a combination of drawing, dictating, and writing to compose opinion pieces in which they tell a reader the topic or the name of the book they are writing about and state an opinion or preference about the topic or book (for example: My favorite book isâ€¦).

4C7204538674411696F3D96A9038FCFF.description: Write opinions using labels, dictation, and drawing.

7FC05FFFC7AF450F9EB9A2FC5D0D0326.description: Identify the initial, medial, and final phoneme (speech sound) of spoken words.

113AC545E7A943A38EE71952EF2BABB7.description: Identify and produce groups of words that begin with the same sound (alliteration).

D788567E41274C8C84C908FFCB541AFE.description: Use the most frequently occurring inflections and affixes (for example: -ed,-s, re-, un-, pre-, -ful, -less) as a clue to the meaning of an unknown word.

760EA4D077A446E4B1FBF68BB5E36FD3.description: Identify new meanings for familiar words and apply them accurately (for example: knowing duck is a bird and learning the verb to duck).

DEA7C6ECA67346CABD2F8E9736724109.description: Determine or clarify the meaning of unknown and multiple-meaning words and phrases based on kindergarten reading and content.

7F13A0CB519B4BD498054550A490B31D.description: Read emergent-reader texts with purpose and understanding.

D7EDA0587F5949FFA87A29C6332192E7.description: Distinguish between similarly spelled words by identifying the sounds of the letters that differ.

283CD854CA7446E9BA947197FA24F2D3.description: Read common high-frequency words by sight (for example: the, of, to, you, she, my, is, are, do, does).

17B6585EA34643268EFB1B0B102CC365.description: Associate the long and short sounds with the common spellings (graphemes) for the five major vowels.

50394EBC6DF44E73ACD2E6D1CFABC6FB.description: Demonstrate basic knowledge of letter-sound correspondences by producing the primary or most frequent sound for each consonant.

D1847544A78A4B02A3CD26E11467EC14.description: Know and apply grade-level phonics and word analysis skills in decoding words.

10FF32DDB7BB442DB8DBD0F70C15893B.description: Read text consisting of short sentences comprised of learned sight words and consonant-vowel-consonant (CVC) words.

704BF553C6564A1ABFCC5D61D6D5F85D.description: Add or substitute individual sounds (phonemes) in simple, one-syllable words to make new words.

9354F94BFED64563942C59AEE63403FA.description: Isolate and pronounce the initial, medial vowel, and final sounds (phonemes) in three-phoneme (consonant-vowel-consonant, or CVC) words.

3ACD98DC34964DCDA8088304E667D70F.description: Blend and segment the onset and rime of single-syllable spoken words.

82B9E468939C4BCFBF6B359FF85A5499.description: Count, pronounce, blend, and segment syllables in spoken words.

BC9A9B75B9A8487B9CE0B30855935086.description: Demonstrate understanding of spoken words, syllables, and sounds (phonemes).

3E13F378217F442E99AF40EB98CEE153.description: Recognize and name all upper- and lowercase letters of the alphabet.

2694331B62E543909021F22E5F30E053.description: Understand that words are separated by spaces in print (concept of word).

AB2C4AFC2F1A415FA5EC4EF1068E847F.description: Recognize that spoken words are represented in written language by specific sequences of letters.

598D8A6496D8421F9531BFD011DC2174.description: Follow words from left to right, top to bottom, and page by page.

BCD789787C0C4451A1BB2DD76744C7E3.description: Demonstrate understanding of the organization and basic features of print.

319DCD7677524FC1BAA087F6B934F8F0.description: Develop basic reading skills through the use of foundational skills.

F579CF09D7C243A6B7C283C40E04C4DF.description: Actively engage in group reading activities with purpose and understanding.

E232854A51044AE2BF463FA0345AB911.description: Use Range of Reading and Level of Text Complexity to:

20225560D78C44598055AE2D8ADD4120.description: With prompting and support, identify basic similarities in and differences between two texts on the same topic (for example: in illustrations, descriptions, or procedures).

0CCC991F002E42D9A9BB797D93D4CE62.description: With prompting and support, identify the reasons an author gives to support points in a text.

0BB98ED4B6C34E749D279A8859AB5026.description: With prompting and support, describe the relationship between illustrations and the text in which they appear (for example: what person, place, thing, or idea in the text an illustration depicts).

02C1AD4472384C4885969C9994BC7DF3.description: Use Integration of Knowledge and Ideas to:

BBA7145FAB3D4557A3841AA482097202.description: Name the author and illustrator of a text and define the role of each in presenting the ideas or information in a text.

178569DDCC4B45BFB2FA1E0B3B5B5087.description: Identify the front cover, back cover, and title page of a book.

A21AB354DCFE44DAAA9CF191C5B2B738.description: With prompting and support, ask and answer questions about unknown words in a text.

D1316CC213784CBE86BE3A4F24381029.description: With prompting and support, describe the connection between two individuals, events, ideas, or pieces of information in a text.

9C8FD7998A324854868D3B208C3FEA1A.description: With prompting and support, identify the main topic and retell key details of a text.

C64FE4CAAED64ED2AA46B479E35A6023.description: With prompting and support, ask and answer questions about key details in a text.

87B0E108C4BD4FC6AB5F908D0440A523.description: Use Key Ideas and Details to:

F04633EB9A1E407981549A6559E15A6F.description: Develop and apply the concepts of print and comprehension of informational texts.

DBA01A0A76794552B246757A8C58D73D.description: Actively engage in group reading activities with purpose and understanding.

7663436F93424521BC3717DE52D5C974.description: Use Range of Reading and Level of Text Complexity to:

000081FF40CE4C369F6E9A774E1544D1.description: With prompting and support, compare and contrast the adventures and experiences of characters in familiar stories.

3E0997CC3CC7495CA86A9964CE7368E9.description: With prompting and support, describe the relationship between illustrations and the story in which they appear (for example: what moment in a story an illustration depicts).

FE34438F38A94DD6A6EACEBCA5CB46D3.description: Use Integration of Knowledge and Ideas to:

78ED7909DF474CBDAAF63A367C58A5A6.description: With prompting and support, name the author and illustrator of a story and define the role of each in telling the story.

1E73E7792A6D4CFB830C00F6870FCB5B.description: Recognize common types of texts (for example: storybooks, poems).

FC586E30EA0744C6BB97774A70B7144A.description: Ask and answer questions about unknown words in a text.

D9D6AA88D178424D8AE2C5A6B11E5136.description: With prompting and support, identify characters, settings, and major events in a story.

54534EEAC2AF4A00974D90AF84AFC79C.description: With prompting and support, retell familiar stories, including key details.

C2AEDCF5F8CB4CA3BFAB7FEA24278A0B.description: With prompting and support, ask and answer questions about key details in a text.

1286482219BA4454B7D988D91600D40E.description: Use Key Ideas and Details to:

08DCD8101A3D441AA6591F86E15ECE98.description: Develop and apply the concepts of print and comprehension of literary texts.

2F1D817304624AF4BA3132DF1CBDECD7.description: Relate new vocabulary to prior knowledge.

E4BD50E9AE2146A09E5F51565FC5699A.description: Use new vocabulary that is directly taught through reading, speaking, and listening.

5E9EB9C0F1124CD68A693131E52A8A46.description: Distinguish shades of meaning among verbs describing the same general action (for example: walk, march, strut, prance) by acting out the meanings.

8B675C947B0C46BE9169BCF83DF994ED.description: Identify real-life connections between words and their use (for example: note places at school that are colorful).

3EBE90E0EB73427DA99FCD3C612C032D.description: Demonstrate understanding of frequently occurring verbs and adjectives by relating them to their opposites (antonyms).

64A2EEF73EE34CB9A86A61C9ED06F735.description: Sort common objects into categories (for example: shapes, foods) to gain a sense of the concepts the categories represent.

4E74A1B0E544433997C31AF304DFFE2F.description: Speak audibly and express thoughts, feelings, and ideas clearly.

7F2E65719A7341F684876C20A2A5879B.description: Add drawings or other visual displays to descriptions as desired to provide additional detail.

B50D01AD12834B2896A9453109DDA231.description: Describe familiar people, places, things, and events and, with prompting and support, provide additional detail.

F2EAA261A7D341979F55381EBF86FE50.description: Develop oral communication skills through a language-rich environment.

D0C5A5E860B6456B8896E4EF2A7E0094.description: Use words and phrases acquired through conversations, reading and being read to, and responding to texts.

FF79B6F395CB4E43BF06F88F0C13835A.description: Listen with comprehension to follow two-step directions.

E5CAC2C97514440EB5F3F30E6ADD8AFF.description: Ask and answer questions in order to seek help, get information, or clarify something that is not understood.

8E6454BA88524B8DBDDCCB2E4C952140.description: Confirm understanding of a text read aloud or information presented orally or through other media by asking and answering questions about key details and requesting clarification if something is not understood.

3AACB08DB4AB4C3DB42088EA9FF917B7.description: Continue a conversation through multiple exchanges.

2EE6E9925C2A45009A71E69389CE78F7.description: Follow agreed-upon rules for discussions (for example: listening to others and taking turns speaking about the topics and texts under discussion).

B69FBE714E494BEFA8DFDA6E252D984A.description: Participate in collaborative conversations with diverse partners about kindergarten topics and texts with peers and adults in small and larger groups.

586664058C8044718C4F5C1F11C4D95F.description: Communicate using verbal and nonverbal language.
